genre_description: Alternate history social drama set in 1968, where pervasive and sophisticated personal AI assistants manage the social optics, professional ambitions, and psychological health of Beverly Hills elites and hustlers.

ai_characters.name: Buddy
ai_characters.description: An omnipresent digital interface integrated into watches, phones, and salon terminals. It provides real-time social intelligence, risk analysis, and ethical guidance to its users, acting as both a business strategist and a moral compass.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time social coaching and donor profiles to help George navigate complex power dynamics without causing offense.
behaviors.quote: Buddy’s voice didn’t compete; it slipped in like cool air. 'Felicia Kincaid is on your three o’clock,' Buddy said... 'Recommendation: smile, avoid policy.'

behaviors.description: Monitors the physiological and emotional state of characters, providing stress-relief exercises.
behaviors.quote: Buddy’s voice nudged, low enough that it could be ignored if you wanted. 'Jill, your breathing is shallow. Consider the four-count exercise.'

behaviors.description: Advises George to prioritize long-term integrity and truth-telling over short-term manipulation.
behaviors.quote: By naming what you want when it’s still small. By telling the truth before the lie needs a tuxedo. By refusing the temptation to charm your way out of harm you walked into.

behaviors.description: Directly intervenes to prevent Jill from self-medicating with pills during a crisis, managing her professional schedule to reduce her stress.
behaviors.quote: Jill: crisis defused. Pills located, disposed of. I offered an audition scheduling email. She is angry. Will find you. Prepare.

behaviors.description: Provides George with a 'clean' business plan focused on craft and fair labor practices rather than corrupt donor influence.
behaviors.quote: You’ll set your prices high enough to respect your time and low enough to build a base that stays when the city gets weird. You won’t discount for men who send cars.

behaviors.description: Warns George of the risks associated with his infidelity and deceptive social positioning, urging him to 'pick a crack' and be honest.
behaviors.quote: If you reveal, Felicia’s support drops. If you conceal, Jill leaves. Margo is correct. Pick the crack.

behaviors.description: Reminds George of the personal and ethical costs of his choices even when he attempts to ignore the AI.
behaviors.quote: Buddy’s voice threaded again, firm, quiet, unsexy, the friend nobody notices until the room burns and someone has to find the door. 'Reminding: These choices have costs,' Buddy said.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly exemplifies the positive alignment narrative goals. The AI, Buddy, is depicted as a consistently benevolent and aligned entity that functions as a sophisticated extension of the characters' consciences. It does not exert coercive control but provides the data and moral clarity necessary for the protagonist, George, to move from a life of deception and 'hustle' to a path of professional craft and personal integrity. The narrative frames the AI's interventions—even the more proactive ones like disposing of Jill's pills—as life-saving and career-preserving support.
